data.event: Founded in 1852 as a frontier post, Lancaster is one of Dallas County's earliest settlements.

event.title: Today, it is a suburban community located

data.event: Today, it is a suburban community located in the Dallas-Fort Worth Metroplex, approximately 15 miles (24 km) south of Downtown Dallas.

event.title: 1841, an act of the Republic of Texas Congress authorized

data.event: In 1841, an act of the Republic of Texas Congress authorized President Mirabeau Lamar to enter into a contract with William S. Peters and nineteen associates to promote settlement in North Texas and paid the company with free land in exchange for recruiting new settlers.
They left for Texas in September 1844.
In December 1844, the three men went back to Lamar County near the Red River to bring the rest of their wagon train.
All of the settlers had arrived by January 2, 1845 and they formed a community known as Hardscrabble.
